title: List of United States Naval Academy alumni
data: Rear Admiral ; cruiser and battleship commander ; Commandant of the Norfolk Naval Shipyard ; USS Beatty ( DD-640 ) and USS Beatty ( DD-756 ) were named for him ; father of Vice Admiral Frank Edmund Beatty , Jr
Vice Admiral ; battleship , steam tanker , and submarine commander ; Commander of the United States Atlantic Fleet ; USS Albert W. Grant was named after him
Admiral ; gunboat , protected cruiser , and battleship commander ; Commander-in-Chief of the United States Pacific Fleet ; USS Rodman and USS Admiral Hugh Rodman were named after him

Rear Admiral ; Constructor of the Navy ; Chief of the Bureau of Construction and Repair ; recipient of the Navy Distinguished Service Medal ; USS Capps and the USS Admiral W. L. Capps were named for him

Rear Admiral ; protected cruiser commander ; USS Twining was named in his honor ; the uncle of Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Nathan Farragut Twining and Marine Corps General Merrill B. Twining

Admiral ; gunboat , cruiser , and battleship commander ; recipient of the Distinguished Service Medal ; great-nephew of U.S. President Zachary Taylor ; grandson of Army Brigadier General Montgomery C. Meigs ; cousin of Army General Montgomery Meigs
Rear Admiral ; yacht , protected cruiser , and battleship commander ; recipient of the Navy Cross ; USS Vogelgesang ( DE-284 ) and USS Vogelgesang ( DD-862 ) were named for him
Rear Admiral ; protected cruiser , battleship , and light cruiser commander ; recipient of the Navy Cross ; USS Williams ( DE-290 ) and USS Williams ( DE-372 ) were named for him
Rear Admiral ; destroyer and submarine commander ; commander of the Yangtze Patrol ; son of Rear Admiral Yates Stirling
Vice Admiral ; Judge Advocate General ; protected cruiser commander ; commander of the Naval Training Station , Newport ; recipient of the Navy Cross
Admiral ; collier , protected cruiser , and battleship commander ; Commander-in-Chief of the United States Fleet ; recipient of the Navy Cross ; USS Reeves was named for him

Captain ; submarine , destroyer , minelayer , armored cruiser , and light cruiser commander ; recipient of the Navy Cross and the Distinguished Service Medal ; grandson of Wisconsin Governor Arthur MacArthur , Sr. ; son of army lieutenant general and Medal of Honor recipient Arthur MacArthur , Jr. ; brother of army general and Medal of Honor recipient Douglas MacArthur ; father of U.S. diplomat Douglas MacArthur II ( son-in-law of U.S. Vice President Alben W. Barkley ; and son-in-law of Rear Admiral Bowman H. McCalla
Lieutenant Commander ; destroyer commander ; recipient of the Navy Cross ; USS Reno was named for him
Captain ; light cruiser commander ; recipient of the Navy Cross ; USS McConnell was named for him
Lieutenant Commander ; airship commander ; recipient of the Navy Cross ; USS Lansdowne was named for him

Rear Admiral ; first Puerto Rican to graduate from the Academy ; Navy Cross recipient for actions against a German submarine in World War I ; captain of USS Vincennes which was sunk at the Battle of Savo Island in 1942 during World War II

Lieutenant ( Junior Grade ) ; recipient of the Distinguished Service Medal ( posthumously ) for his actions after his ship , USS Jacob Jones ( DD-61 ) , was torpedoed by a German submarine ; two destroyers , USS Kalk ( DD-170 ) and USS Kalk ( DD-611 ) , were named for him
